intro: Tanacetopsis tripinnatifida, commonly known as the three-feathered tansy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
